title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
Saudi Arabia's crown prince ordered the operation that led to the death of journalist Jamal Khashoggi in 2018, according to an intelligence report cleared for release by the White House on Friday.

---

Johnson & Johnson's single-dose Covid-19 vaccine worked safely and should be authorized for use in the U.S., a panel of experts advised federal health regulators.

Evidence is growing that U.S. vaccination efforts are helping to keep vulnerable nursing-home residents alive.

WHO coronavirus investigators are seeking information about a second food market in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

---

Senate Democrats began preparing a backup plan for raising the minimum wage at some large companies as part of their coronavirus relief package, as the House was set to pass an aid bill.

---

U.S. airstrikes in Syria targeted an important way station in an Iranian network used to move weapons and fighters across the Middle East.

---

Gunmen kidnapped 317 girls from a boarding school in Nigeria, police said, the latest in a rising tide of high-school abductions.
